bibl.title: Despatch from James Robert Spurgeon to David J. Hill, August 1, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Aug. 1, 1900

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. 6 SEP 1900 DEPT. OF STATE

div1.p: Honorable David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to herewith transmit to the department two copies of the tariff laws and amendments now in operation in the Republic of Liberia.
The same was requested of this legation by the Philadelphia Commercial Museum. I send two copies that one may remain with the department.
I have the honor to remain, Sir, your obed't servant, James Robert Spungeon, Charge
Inclosures: As above recited.
TARIFF.
ENACTED BY THE SENATE AND HOUSE REPRESENTATIVES OF THE REPUBLIC F LIBERIA IN LEGISLATURE ASSEM- BLED. APPROVED JANY 28TH 1890 AND AMENDED JANY. 21ST, 1893.
ALL IMPORT DUTIES PAYABLE IN GOLD.

all other goods not enumerated in the foregoing there leved and collected a duty of twelve and a half per cent em. Transient trader not excepted.

Export Tariff

ISSUED BY AUTHORITY.
Transcript
From the Acts of the Legislature of the Republic of Liberia for the session of 1899-1900.
Page 36 - Joint Resolution protecting the Revenue of the Republic of Liberia against fraud.

Whereas it is the policy of some merchants transacting business in this Republic to import in this Republic empty demijons, some filled with water, some with rice and some with sawdust, for the purpose of defrauding the government of its
